poem:
**Saturday Night Revisited**

Under studio light,  
laughter weaves through  
a history of skits.  
Echoes stage-dive  
from memory's screen—  
a patchwork of faces,  
time stitched in joy.  
Years collapse  
into applause,  
each note  
a thread in  
comedy's quilt.  
We gather,  
a nation  
on couch benches,  
smiling at reflections  
of what was -  
of what spins on.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Saturday Night Live: star-packed 50th special brings laughs and emotion If the 50th season of Saturday Night Live has, up until now, felt somewhat underwhelming, this past week has made up for it. It’s been one celebration after another, including a star-studded live concert that aired this past Friday, a repeat of the show’s very first episode during its regular Saturday-night time slot, and any number of self-produced and third-party retrospectives across the media landscape.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Saturday Night Live: star-packed 50th special brings laughs and emotion If the 50th season of Saturday Night Live has, up until now, felt somewhat underwhelming, this past week has made up for it. It’s been one celebration after another, including a star-studded live concert that aired this past Friday, a repeat of the show’s very first episode during its regular Saturday-night time slot, and any number of self-produced and third-party retrospectives across the media landscape.
